title: Taking Part?
abstractText:
Taking Part? is the ESRC research cluster for developing quality research on active citizenship and community empowerment with the Third Sector. It is an ESRC funded partnership between The University of Lincoln, Goldsmiths University of London and Manchester Metropolitan University with The Office for the Third Sector and the Barrow Cadbury Trust.

It builds on the partners' research expertise and the national Take Part Network of third sector organisations and higher education institutions, concerned with strengthening civil society, promoting active citizenship, equalities and community empowerment.

It is developing innovative approaches to community engagement and empowerment building on previous research on facilitating user and community audit and voice in service planning and delivery. The cluster enables the voices of the most disadvantaged groups to be heard effectively, within agendas for social change, solidarity and justice.

It will underpin a portfolio of research and research-related activities over a 5 year period and support postgraduate students through PhD studies, employ Knowledge Transfer Associates and staff placements and smaller-scale research activities, also promoting publication and dissemination of research findings to diverse audiences.
